p: The selection pressures acting on the transmission of ZIKV was inferred by using Datamonkey web server ( http://www.datamonkey.org/, USA). [ 24] To test if positive selection has occurred on a proportion of branches, adaptive branch-site random effects likelihood (aBSREL) method [ 25] was used. In the scenario where all branches were tested, P values at each branch were corrected for multiple testing by using the Holm-Bonferroni correction. Significance was assessed using the likelihood ratio test at a threshold of P ≤ 0.05. In addition, we estimated the dN and dS substitution rates on a per-codon site basis for each genome. Sites evolving under positive selection under a proportion of branches were detected by using the mixed effects model of evolution (MEME). [ 26] Sites under positive selection in the entire phylogeny were detected by using single likelihood ancestor counting (SLAC) [ 27] and Fast, Unconstrained Bayesian AppRoximation (FUBAR) [ 28] methods. The significant level was set at P ≤ 0.05 and posterior probabilities >0.9 in FUBAR.
